result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Allen Leopold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided within one week of the date of sentencing and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:36 p.m. Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court appears with authorization.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15TR1732 & 15TR1733 - DRI. Court orders: Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA sample to be provided within one week from today's date and surcharge assessed. Appeal rights mailed to DE.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi request plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Case Called @ 1:24 PM:  Defendant Patrick Allen Leopold in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. ADA argues as to bond.  No objection to bond request.    NGP received and entered.   SPD confirms eligibility.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 10:20 am.
